alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:57AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL GREENBRIER COUNTY THROUGH 230 AM EDT... At 151 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms that were passing repeatedly over the communities of Anjean, Quinwood and Rupert. These storms were moving to the southeast at 25 mph. Automated rain gages in the area are indicating these storms are producing prolonged rounds of locally heavy rain at rates of 1 to 1.5 inches per hour. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rainelle... Rupert... Quinwood... Bingham... Trout... Williamsburg... and Meadow Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways, and be especially cautious at night when the dangers of flooding are more difficult to see. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
